content.description:
Dykes Next Door is to the left of Critical View starting underneath two parallel and diagonally running dykes.  the first fifteen feet are the crux of the climb with a 5.9 portion to the top. 

  From South Seas sign-in, walk left on trail (toward Wrinkled Rock campground)  for approximately 50 meters and Critical View will be on your right. 

  Very fun climb!

climbs.name: Critical View
climbs.fa: Bob Bowman, Vernon Phinney-1985 Ground Up

content.description:
This is a frustrating 5.8, and that is because the first 8 feet are balancy 5.10!  An excellent route to sandbag beginner climbers on, which I found out on my first day of climbing as I never really got off the ground. 

  This is the bolt line closest to Hornets Nest on Critical View.  Stand up on a large blocky foothold, which is much harder and more delicate than it looks.  A few more thin moves get you to the second bolt, and then cruiser 5.8 to the top.

Granite formation to the North of Hornet's Nest on the Honeycomb Wall side.  Contains two routes on the Western side.  They are shorter routes (Dykes Next Door (5.11a) and Critical View (5.8)), and both a lot of fun.  Try'em!
